name: Hotel Oceania Brest Centre

reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Can walk to many restaurants, bars, and the waterfront. Free street parking is possible at night. Unlike other hotels in Europe, breakfast is not included. The hotel provides it on the honor system at 14 Euro.
reviews.title: Very nice, clean, modern hotel in downtown Brest

reviews.text: We chose the Oceania because its a 5 minute drive from the Oceanopolis aquariam (which is excellent)
reviews.title: never again!!

reviews.text: We booked on line and were of the understanding that children under 12 stayed without charge in our room
reviews.title: Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist was not interested in listening to our understanding of the booking ,so we had to book an additional room at the full rate!
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: I've stayed in the Oceania three times now and each time has been good. The staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and well maintained. There are some standard size rooms, but also some bigger ones, with large glazed bathrooms, allowing you to watch the TV while having a shower!
reviews.title: Good position in the centre of town (right opposite the pub)

reviews.text: You do get some street noise (if in an outward facing room), but check the windows; the windows have secondary glazing, and on my last visit I found the outside window open, while the internal closed.
reviews.title: Good hotel, friendly staff and excellent restaurant

reviews.text: Breakfast is expensive and not worth the bother really.
reviews.title: A little expensive but very comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pub across the road is very good (The Blind Piper), with a good selection of beers, though it does play rock music and seems to be a younger persons place, which may put some people off. It's open until 1am every night so this may sometimes add to the street noise.
reviews.title: Good hotel, right in the centre of town

reviews.text: There's a large underground car park round the corner, which you can park on the ground (top) level for free after 18:00, or securely in the lower levels for a fee. Note the opening and closing times as it opens later on a Sunday morning, which may be an issue if you need to get your car out.
reviews.title: Finally a luxury hotel in my travels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As you probably have read by now, the city of Brest has nothing special in itself, but its position and size make it a good place to stay to explore the area of Finisterre in the french Britanny.
reviews.title: A very good option for Brest in Bretagne

reviews.text: In Brest, the Oceania (there is another hotel of the Oceania chain, called Brest, of inferior category) is a perfect option: central, very easy to locate, modern and comfortable. The wifi is free and works well (very necessary to plan the excursions in the surroundings). The breakfast is fine but not great. There is a restaurant in the hotel (the Nautilus) that serves good food and it is very popular.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in brest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 nights buisiness trip. Personal and restaurant above average, good locatoon close to port and restaurants.
reviews.title: Good central hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pro: meet 3 receptoonists all very professional, polite and friendly with guests. Restaurant providing excellent foods a la carte. Nice breackfast.
reviews.title: Last 4 nights of honeymoon stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: standard rooms are quite little.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in centre of city.

description: THIS CHIC HOTEL FULLY REFURBISHED INE 2007 AS WELL AS THE NAUTILUS RESTAURANT WITH ITS IMPRESSIVE 3000 LITRES AQUARIUM BOTH MODERN AND CONTEMPORY LIGHT MODERN GUESTROOMS LOCATED ON THE MAIN SIAM STREET IN BREST
